Title: Senior Data Scientist - Marketing Science
Description:
Smartly has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Marketing Science focussed Data Scientist to join our growing Performance team in EMEA.

We are looking for a customer-facing data scientist who enjoys analyzing sophisticated systems and can communicate findings to customers and partners clearly and concisely. Your role is crucial in making sure we can systematically improve optimization across our customers!

You will work with our distributed team of customer-facing data scientists based in our offices in Helsinki, New York, and San Francisco. In this role you will analyze, validate, and test standard methodologies in paid social advertising. You will be working closely together with both product development and commercial colleagues.

As a Marketing Science Data Scientist you will...


Perform quantitative research to support sales and marketing proof points
Drive thought leadership in the areas of optimization, testing, attribution and market insights within the Smartly organization and across the customer base
Perform performance meta analyses, vertical research, and playbooks based on scientifically sound analytics
Serve as the day-to-day trusted measurement consultant for key strategic advertisers by analyzing customers’ performance marketing data and develop methods to determine what works and, more meaningfully, why it works
Lead customer communication on Smartly optimization features, and A/B and incrementality testing, and sophisticated research results to a general audience
Drive customer adoption of best standards, measurement methodologies, and products



What We Are Looking For...


5+ years experience in marketing measurement, analytics, growth marketing, or a related field
Experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets in Python and SQL
Master's Degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field or similar knowledge
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as familiarity with large data sets and data manipulation tools
Ability and willingness to become an expert in digital performance marketing
Ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with technical and non-technical collaborators in a customer-facing role
Ability to work from our Berlin or Helsinki office at least 2 days a week (hybrid)



Meet Smartly

Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.

Visit Smartly.io to learn more.


Show more

We are looking for a customer-facing data scientist who enjoys analyzing sophisticated systems and can communicate findings to customers and partners clearly and concisely. Your role is crucial in making sure we can systematically improve optimization across our customers!

You will work with our distributed team of customer-facing data scientists based in our offices in Helsinki, New York, and San Francisco. In this role you will analyze, validate, and test standard methodologies in paid social advertising. You will be working closely together with both product development and commercial colleagues.

As a Marketing Science Data Scientist you will...

  • Perform quantitative research to support sales and marketing proof points
  • Drive thought leadership in the areas of optimization, testing, attribution and market insights within the Smartly organization and across the customer base
  • Perform performance meta analyses, vertical research, and playbooks based on scientifically sound analytics
  • Serve as the day-to-day trusted measurement consultant for key strategic advertisers by analyzing customers’ performance marketing data and develop methods to determine what works and, more meaningfully, why it works
  • Lead customer communication on Smartly optimization features, and A/B and incrementality testing, and sophisticated research results to a general audience
  • Drive customer adoption of best standards, measurement methodologies, and products


What We Are Looking For...

  • 5+ years experience in marketing measurement, analytics, growth marketing, or a related field
  • Experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets in Python and SQL
  • Master's Degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field or similar knowledge
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as familiarity with large data sets and data manipulation tools
  • Ability and willingness to become an expert in digital performance marketing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with technical and non-technical collaborators in a customer-facing role
  • Ability to work from our Berlin or Helsinki office at least 2 days a week (hybrid)


Meet Smartly

Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.

Visit Smartly.io to learn more.

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Ad Tech (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

Be our next Hero! - Join the world’s leading local delivery platform.

We are looking for Staff Data Scientists (all genders) to join the Ad Tech data science team in our mission to deliver consistently amazing experiences.

You will be a thought leader, driving innovation by designing and deploying our models to the forefront of technology to solve complex problems, delivering revenue for Delivery Hero at the frontline of our growth & profitability journey.

At Delivery Hero, AdTech introduces people to new food they love and enables our partners to meet their future customers at the perfect moment. We have developed a range of products to offer advertising solutions for restaurants helping them to increase their visibility and reach, improve their order conversion, and eventually drive more sales by covering the entire marketing funnel. Operating across over 50 countries around the clock, our Ad Tech connects the ideal advertiser with the ideal customer millions of times every day. In 2024/25, Ad Tech is a fundamental area for us on our path to profitability and is predicted to generate more than 1 billion euros in revenue for Delivery Hero; our data science team is at the heart of this growth, powering personalisation, relevance, and recommendation.

The Ad Tech data science team operates within the wider Vendor Data tribe whose mission is to drive innovation, insight-driven decision making and to solve business problems through a culture of excellence and openness. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions covering a host of business opportunities across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:


Spearhead a revolution of Ad Tech at Delivery Hero through the innovative application of cutting edge tools and techniques such as neural networks and reinforcement learning covering areas such as ad ranking, bidding strategies, and ad pacing driving unparalleled improvements in advertising campaigns.
Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve ad relevance, click-through rates, and conversion metrics.
Lead research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in AdTech and machine learning, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's advertising products and algorithms. Remain at the forefront of industry and research developments incorporating new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows and models.
Serve as a subject matter expert in data science and machine learning, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data science team.


What you need to be successful


You are an industry-leading talent at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver enormous value to the business.
You raise the performance of other team members through effective and mature mentorship and constructive collaboration to benefit others from your deep understanding and experience of data science.
You have extensive expertise in building and training complex neural network models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit centering around deep learning i.e. Keras and ideally Tensorflow and TFX
Through the seamless use of SQL queries you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine learning solutions.
You write clean, production-level code and are able to effectively set up your environment to minimise testing loops influencing the entire team to work more efficiently and reliably.
You are familiar with deploying and developing complex neural networks to serve live traffic and experience collaborating with ML engineers in cloud systems, ideally GCP.
You love to learn, are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from a variety of teams in a diverse environment.


Nice to have:


Implementing neural networks to specifically solve Ad Tech challenges would be highly desirable.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior IoT Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is a dynamic Green Tech IoT company based in the heart of Berlin, seeking a talented and passionate Senior/Lead Data Scientist to join their team. They are developing innovative solutions to address pressing environmental challenges through the power of Wildfire Detection.




As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in unlocking the potential of our data, driving product innovation, and shaping our company's growth.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement robust data pipelines to efficiently process and transform large volumes of sensor data.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and insights that inform product development and business strategy.
Build predictive models to optimise system performance, enhance user experience, and drive operational efficiency.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning to drive innovation.




Qualifications:

Master’s or PhD degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science or a related field.
Proficient in Python.
Strong experience with machine learning frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn.
Strong experience with modelling tabular data: Time Series Forecasting, Decision Trees, XGBoost, Ensemble techniques.
Strong experience with advanced data analysis techniques: PCA, T-SNE, k-means clustering.
Experience with end-to-end ML pipeline tooling: ETL pipelines, MLflow.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




What they offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package plus stock
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects with a high impact
Collaborative and inspiring work environment
Flexible work arrangements
Continuous learning and development opportunities




If you are a data scientist with a passion for sustainability and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply! Join us in building a greener future.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Enterprise Solutions Unit)
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance.

This is our role as a Data Scientist for those who like to design, develop, test and maintain multiple machine learning-based automated repeatable SEO analysis (‘SEO Workflows’), and perform targeted data analysis assignments for external clients along with the SEO Consulting team.

Tasks in the role

Designing SEO Workflow prototype


Collect workflow requirements from internal and external SEO experts.
Develop a simplified solution prototype.
Test the concept with SEO experts.



Defining the requirements for the workflows


Define success criteria for workflow performance.
Define API contracts to collect the data from Semrush Data Warehouse.
Develop the workflow output.



Developing the workflows


Develop the scripts to perform stable, repeatable, and scalable data analysis.
Develop request scripts to support and enable the main workflow script.



Developing workflow tests


Develop various tests and perform them in testing and production environments, including integration unit, regression, performance and other types of testing.



Custom analysis assignments for external clients


In close collaboration with the SEO Consulting team, develop custom SEO workflows for external clients to perform specific analysis to meet client needs.



Requirements

Who we are looking for


Bachelor's or higher degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Strong fundamentals in Machine Learning and experience with bringing models into production.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications, including an understanding of their architecture and practical use cases.
Strong programming skills, including proficiency in languages like Python and DS libraries such as pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, transformers, streamlit.
Knowledge of API integration and data collection from various sources.
Experience in conducting comprehensive testing to ensure the reliability and performance of workflows.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external clients.



They say there are no perfect candidates, but that might well be you, if


Knowledge of SEO best practices and industry trends is a plus.
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better.



A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Torch team is responsible for building ML-based automated workflows within the Semrush Enterprise Platform.

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


Work format Choice: It’s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both.
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees



Finally, a Little More About Our Company

We’ve been developing our product for 15 years and have been awarded G2's Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients’ real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

Our Data Science team is a diverse and talented group of individuals with strong expertise in discovering and understanding customer needs, making data-driven decisions within an ambiguous problem space, and rapidly prototyping and iterating on data products.

Building on 10 years of experience in the US, Flatiron’s international team is scaling Flatiron’s approach in new countries. Streamlined teams in each market are establishing partnerships with local cancer providers, and developing high-quality real-world data for researchers around the world. Data Scientists are embedded on those teams and their work touches every aspect of Flatiron’s international product and strategy.

Specifically, you’ll:



Rapidly iterate on early stage products where a hybrid skill set of product intuition, customer empathy, and data expertise is essential.
Develop a deep understanding of source data and develop data processing and quality assurance approaches for both structured and unstructured data.
Help shape our approach to integrating machine learning, natural language processing and other automated technologies into Flatiron’s data processing design.
Collaborate with cross functional stakeholders to develop and implement shared data processing strategies and analytic methods to enable real-world evidence generation based on global datasets.
Devise and build data analyses and visualizations that provide value to Flatiron’s data partners and customers.
Immerse yourself in business and technical context to help your team identify opportunities for optimizing our processes and unlocking new value from our unique datasets.
Help mentor and grow other data scientists.



Who You Are

You're a kind, collaborative and analytic problem solver and value the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition,



You have 4+ years of industry experience in relevant roles.
You’re impact-oriented, and care deeply about creating real change for customers, users, and ultimately patients. You choose the right, rather than the flashiest, method available to reach your goals.
You have a strong background in statistics or analytics and can fit the appropriate analysis approach to complex business or research problems.
You have a track record of applying Machine Learning models to solve product problems and drive business impact.
You are a clear and confident communicator who can explain technical concepts to business and clinical partners.
You are versatile and can easily pick up new programming languages and tools, but come with strong experience in Python.
You have a record of success driving initiatives forward by generating buy-in, managing complexity, and continuously delivering business impact.
You are proficient in English.



Extra credit



You have experience working with healthcare-related data.
You have experience productionizing ML models and integrating them with data processing pipelines.
You have experience in Data Engineering, including ETL and data warehousing tools.



Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.
Show more

  • You have a record of success driving initiatives forward by generating buy-in, managing complexity, and continuously delivering business impact.
  • You are proficient in English.


Extra credit


  • You have experience working with healthcare-related data.
  • You have experience productionizing ML models and integrating them with data processing pipelines.
  • You have experience in Data Engineering, including ETL and data warehousing tools.


Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Digital Waffle is proud to have partnered with a company at the forefront of the renewable energy revolution, using artificial intelligence to optimise energy production, integration, and efficiency. We're looking for a passionate Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the future of sustainable energy.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with domain experts to identify renewable energy challenges where machine learning can provide solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models for tasks such as:
Solar energy forecasting
Wind turbine performance optimization
Demand response management for the power grid
Predictive maintenance for renewable energy infrastructure
Oversee the entire machine learning lifecycle, from data acquisition and pre-processing to model deployment and monitoring.
Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in machine learning for renewable energy applications.
Mentor and guide junior engineers on the team and lead recruitment of new team members.




Qualifications:

MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and their applications (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning).
Proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Experience working with big data and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
A passion for renewable energy and sustainability.




Benefits:

Be part of a mission-driven company that's making a real difference in the world.
Work on challenging and impactful projects with real-world applications.
Collaborate with a talented team of engineers and scientists.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.

Show more

Title: Freelance Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Role: Senior Data Scientist

Project Length: 6 Months initially + potential extensions

Work Location: 100% remote

Project Languages: English and German

Capacity: 40 hours per week




This role is suited to a Senior Data Scientist who has previous experience modelling ranking algorithms, particularly for optimisation within an e-commerce environment.




Utilising your chosen open-source LTR (learning to rank) framework, you will build a new model which can optimise search results ranking based on multiple variables.




Key Tasks

Develop an LTR framework module to train models that can optimise custom targets depending on the context.

Implement LTR compatibility with a selection of value added services which are offered across the marketplace.

Optimisation of specific transaction types and marketplace features.

Explore and develop personalisation features with the ranking system to cater to individual user preferences.

Work towards an unbiased LTR system which ensures fairness and diversity.

Manage complexities around compatibility and the balance between ad revenue and user experience.




Ideal Skillset:

Previous experience working on complex ranking models – ideally within e-commerce / search results environment
Deep knowledge in LTR machine learning
Python & relevant Python libraries
NLP
AWS cloud services (desirable)
Show more

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Kertos Intro

⚠️ Given the nature of this research project's funding, you have to be a resident of Berlin, Germany and open to spending 2-3 days in the office on site there. If this is not your case, please don’t apply, as it is a hard requirement. Please also note that we cannot offer assistance with relocation or visa sponsorship at the moment.

Your purpose at Kertos

You’re part of our newest Product Squad in Berlin which will focus on our latest research project to push the automation capabilities of the Kertos Platform even further. As Machine Learning Engineer here at Kertos, you’ll own the machine learning aspect of this project, where we continuously integrate cutting-edge models and frameworks to bring various LLM-based features to life. From conceptualising models, knowledge graphs to bringing the models to live and ensuring its functionality across the whole lifecycle of our models – you’ll have a huge impact on the future of our company and revolutionise the information security and data privacy landscape with us!

What You’ll Be Doing Here


Contribute in product development: bring in your ideas and automate workflows, improve suggestions and increase user satisfaction even further
Develop technical concepts and approaches across the whole development lifecycle
Collaborate with your team members to achieve internal automation as well as a seamless integration into our existing tech stack
Integrate MLOps principles and tools that help you and your team for development
Make sure the developed models work as expected in our production environments in a secure and stable way
Be creative in acquiring new data automatically to enhance our models and systems
Build the foundation of various AI-driven use cases for the Kertos platform


The skills, motivation, and mentality you should bring


You are an expert when it comes to Python and Machine Learning with multiple years of professional experience
You have hands-on knowledge about MLOps and bringing models to production
If you also have experience with knowledge graphs and/or NLP & embeddings, this would be a big plus
You constantly challenge our status quo, love to spark innovation and strive to grow with us, as a team
You are a strong communicator and have excellent collaboration abilities to effectively work in cross-functional, agile teams


Why Kertos


Number one: You get to build our Machine Learning toolchain and software from the ground up, using the newest technologies
Best of both worlds: As this is a research project, you will get both the benefits of research and cutting edge technology as well as startup culture in our Berlin Office
You are Kertos: Don’t like something? Could be done better? You have the freedom to push things forward and contribute to making Kertos a great place to work
Unique opportunity: Join the growing team of one of Europe’s most promising early stages companies and to work directly with our CTO and co-founder Alex
Regular Feedback: We foster an open feedback culture and support your growth with regular 1-on-1 meetings
Keep growing: To boost your professional and personal growth, we provide you with a Personal Development Budget of 1.500€ per year
Mental Health: We've partnered with Likeminded to prioritize your well-being, offering personalized mental health support for all employees
Cutting Edge Technology: Leading VCs have invested in our vision to revolutionize how data protection management and compliance measures are handled sustainably
For Sports Enthusiasts: We subsidize your Wellpass membership for your physical fitness for a better work-life balance
Teamwork Makes the Dream Work: We are a strong team that supports each other, and we also have a lot of fun together beyond work and across different locations


Sounds like you are the one we’ve been looking for?

Perfect, let's have a chat! Just send in your CV. We are excited to meet you soon.

In case you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Lena from our People & Culture team. She's happy to answer all your questions.

About Us

At Kertos, we've made it our mission to develop Europe's first compliance automation system to enhance compliance operations for everyone. We are a technology company, founded in 2021, providing a novel no-code system integration solution for data privacy operations and requirements. Our platforms offers complete automation of data privacy functions, including deletion concepts, access requests, and RoPAs, all with just one click. Backed by some of the most renowned VCs and Business Angels, we are looking for passionate individuals to grow our team and rethink data privacy with us. Join us on our ride toward the future of compliance!
Show more

Title: Software Engineer in Reinforcement Learning (M/W/D)
Description:
Do you want to know more about us?




Of course we can tell you the story of our company and our areas of expertise! But in the end,the most important thing is what your future T&S colleagues think about T&S.




What they like best :




Flexibility - Of course you get flexible working hours, home-office facilities and 30 days' holiday a year, but there is more to it than that. It is also the benefits that consulting brings. At T&S, whether you are a junior or an experienced consultant, you can move quickly through different projects, develop your skills and accelerate your career.




Projects - You will work in a stimulating environment. You will be in contact with experts and be at the heart of innovations. You can work in different industries or become an expert in a particular field. You can take advantage of paid training, certifications and language courses (English and German)!




Atmosphere - You will be with international and multi-cultural teams. Whether it is a Potluck, Karaoke, Karting, Oktoberfest or Summer and Winter parties, we want to have a good time with you. Having fun at work is important! It is a great way to bond and get to know each other better (but of course it is never an obligation!).




In more formal terms, we are a consulting firm specializing in engineering, IT and digital project management. We are an international company with a Franco-German DNA. Our 3,500 employees are of 45 different nationalities and are spread across 27 offices in 10 countries, including France, Germany, Switzerland, Belgium, the UK, Singapore, Hong Kong, Portugal, Egypt, and the Netherlands.




Job Description :

Are you excited about building high-performance robotic systems that can perceive, learn, and act intelligently alongside humans? Our team is creating new products and technologies that make this possible, at global scale.

Our software team is seeking broad, curious engineers to join our diverse, full-stack team. In addition to holistically designing, building, and delivering end-to-end robotic systems, our team is responsible for the core infrastructure and tools that serve as the backbone of our robotic applications, enabling roboticists, machine learning scientists, and software engineers to collaborate and deploy systems in the lab and in the field. Our work spans real-time software, machine learning engineering, big data, simulation, and more.




Key job responsibilities

Architect, design, and implement robotic software applications, infrastructure, and tools.
Work with stakeholders across hardware, science, and operations teams to iterate on systems design and implementation.
Create robust, high-quality, well-tested software to interface with robots, control sensors, actuators, and other hardware.
Collaborate with machine learning and robotic controls experts to implement and deploy algorithms, such as machine learning models.
Profile, tune, and optimize system performance.
Create re-usable software and systems to accelerate robotics development.
Maintain high standards by participating in reviews, designing for fault tolerance and operational excellence, and creating mechanisms for continuous improvement.




Basic qualifications

2+ years of experience in reinforcement learning
5+ years of professional software development experience with at least one modern language such as Python, C++, Java, or Kotlin including object-oriented design.
3+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Bachelor’s Degree or greater in Computer Science/Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent.
Proficiency with professional software engineering practices & standard practices for the full software life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Experience in software design and architecture. Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills.




Preferred qualifications

Experience with AWS (S3, Lambda, SQS).
Master’s or advanced degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent.
8+ years of industry software development experience, with background in design patterns, data structures, and test-driven development.
Experience in one or more relevant technical areas: robotics, computer vision, machine learning, sensors, real-time systems, embedded systems, and simulation.
Experience with interdisciplinary developments that involve hardware, software, and algorithm co-design.
Experience supporting large-scale infrastructure and tool development for scientific/engineering users.
Solid fundamentals in operating systems, embedded systems, or systems programming. Demonstrable experience in building, programming and integrating software and hardware for robotic systems. Independent and ability to work with minimal direction.
Demonstrated experience incubating and productionizing new technology, working closely with research scientists and technical teams from idea generation through implementation




Our positions are open to recognized as disabled workers.

T&S Group promotes diversity and equality in the workplace.

All qualified M/F/O candidates are considered for employment on an equal basis.

Show more

Our positions are open to recognized as disabled workers.

T&S Group promotes diversity and equality in the workplace.

All qualified M/F/O candidates are considered for employment on an equal basis.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (d/f/m)
Description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

Join eBay's innovative team that stands at the intersection of cutting-edge machine learning technology and e-commerce. Our team is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive culture where creativity and collaboration drive the development of intelligent systems that enhance the global online marketplace. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will have a significant role in designing and developing machine learning systems, which involves assessing and organizing data, driving tests and experiments, and generally monitoring and optimizing machine learning processes to help develop strong performing machine learning systems. You will collaborate closely with multi-functional teams including managers, developers, business analysts and data scientists to deliver products and services that leverage machine learning techniques.

What You Will Accomplish


Designing, developing, and researching Machine Learning systems, models
Studying, transforming, and converting data science prototypes
Searching and selecting appropriate data sets before performing data collection and data modeling
Performing statistical analysis and using results to improve models
Training and retraining machine learning systems and models as needed, monitor quality of the models in production
Identifying differences in data distribution that could affect model performance in real-world situations
Visualizing data for deeper insights
Analyzing the use cases of machine learning algorithms and ranking them by their success probability
Enriching existing machine learning frameworks and libraries
Verifying data quality and/or ensuring it via data cleaning



What You Will Bring


Proven experience in building machine learning models in computer vision or natural language processing related fields
Experience in modern ML tooling related to experiment management, containerization, orchestration, processing pipelines and data version control
Experience in bringing ML models in production, monitoring and maintaining them throughout their entire life cycle. Familiarity with DevOps and MLOps cultures
Proficient in Python for scripting and data manipulation tasks and software development best practices
Proficient in SQL for querying and managing databases
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Fluent spoken and written English



What Sets You Apart


Proven track record in leading multi-functional teams and collaborating effectively with partners at different levels of the organization
Experience with PyTorch, Google Cloud, Kubeflow, AirFlow, ElasticSearch
A coaching & knowledge sharing mindset
Experience in working with crowdsourcing approaches for collecting datasets
Experience in mentoring junior positions and collaboration with data analytics or data engineers on the projects
Experience in working remotely



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes: HI, NM)" excludes residents of Hawaii and New Mexico.

This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, you’ll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your team’s focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We’re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we’re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is €69,000 - €93,400 gross per year.
Show more
HTML:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Title: Data Scientist - Natural Language Processing (NLP) (w/m/d) - hybrides Arbeiten (Remote & Präsenz)
Description:
Akkodis - entstanden durch den Zusammenschluss von AKKA & Modis - ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Engineering & IT. Als globaler Partner in einer sich ständig verändernden Technologie- & Wettbewerbsumgebung unterstützen wir unsere Kunden mit unserem 360°-Angebot dabei, eine nachhaltigere & smartere Zukunft zu gestalten. Vereint durch unsere gemeinsame Leidenschaft für Technologie & Talente betrachten wir die Welt aus einem neuen Blickwinkel. Unsere 50.000 motivierten Ingenieur:innen & Digitalexpert:innen gehen dabei täglich über das Mögliche hinaus, um Unglaubliches zu schaffen

Dann suchen wir Dich für ein Projekt unseres Kunden - ab sofort.

Deine Aufgaben



Du kannst bereits erste Berufserfahrung in der Analyse komplexer Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen mittels Natural Language Processing (NLP) Modellen, Computer Vision, Machine Learning vorweisen
Du wirkst an der Weiterentwicklung KI-basierter Lösungen zur automatisierten Erkennung, Interpretation und Verarbeitung von Audio-Video Materialien mit
Du erschließt neue Informationen und Zugänge zu bisher nicht nutzbaren Daten. Dazu evaluierst Du neue Technologien und entwickelst MVPs bis hin zum Einsatz ins Live-System
Du wirkst an der Weiterentwicklung KI-basierter Lösungen (Algorithmen)




Was Du dafür mitbringst



Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes (Fach-) Hochschulstudium im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Gute Erfahrung in Natural Language Processing angewandt auf nicht-wissenschaftliche Datensätze
Erfahrung mit manuellen und automatisiserten Methoden auf Textbausteine/-elemente (Algorithmen)
Erfahrung mit Pytorch, Tensorflow und/oder einem anderen gängigen DL-Framework
Erfahrung mit mindestens einem Python-API-Framework
Nice-to-have: Erfahrung im Umgang mit Machine Learning, AWS, Git und Docker
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Was Dich erwartet



Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm




Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.

Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Dein Kontakt Frau Michelle Boysen

karriere-berlin@akkodis.com

Akkodis Germany Tech Experts GmbH Information Technology

Lietzenburger Str. 51

10789 Berlin

Telefon +49 30 20398417

www.akkodis.com/de

Title: Bio- AI Engineer
Description:
Please note: to apply for this job requires expertise with Mass spectrometry data OR NGS data. AI focus from other industries is not relevant.

Job Title: AI Engineer

Location: Berlin, Germany (Hybrid Working Available)

Company Overview: The company leverages advanced AI technologies to explore the therapeutic potential of natural compounds, focusing on areas with substantial unmet medical needs.

Role Overview: The AI Platform Engineer will take charge of managing and enhancing the company’s AI platform, a sophisticated system that integrates computational metabolomics, cheminformatics, and knowledge graphs.

This role is crucial in advancing the platform's capabilities to support the discovery and development of new therapies.

Key Responsibilities


Knowledge Graph Management: Utilize and manage knowledge graph technologies to support complex data integration and analysis, facilitating the identification of new therapeutic targets.
Cloud Infrastructure: Implement and maintain cloud-based solutions to support the scalability and flexibility of the platform, ensuring efficient processing and storage of large datasets.
Metabolomics Analysis: Lead efforts in the analysis of metabolomic data, particularly focusing on mass spectrometry (mass spec) data, to discover neuroactive compounds.
Platform Management: Oversee the overall AI platform, ensuring all components are functioning optimally. This includes enhancing platform capabilities, improving scalability, and integrating new technologies as needed.
Project Leadership: Define project goals and lead the team in setting strategic directions, guiding where the platform should go and how to achieve those objectives.
MLOps Integration: Apply MLOps principles to efficiently transition machine learning models from development into production environments, enabling the delivery of AI-driven products.


Required Skills And Experience


PHD/ MSc (Machine Learning, Bioinformatics, Mathematics or Physics) + 2/3 years of experience in a company setting.
Advanced proficiency in Python, with experience using libraries and frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Strong background in developing robust data pipelines. (eg. ETL processes, data modeling, and data architecture).
Expertise in graph database technologies (e.g., RDF, Neo4j) and query languages (e.g., SPARQL, Cypher); familiarity with relational databases is a plus.
Demonstrated experience in deploying machine learning models, e.g. NLP or deep learning, within live production settings.
Ability to work independently within a cross-functional team, managing tasks and driving projects with minimal supervision.
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.


Preferred Qualifications: Experience with life science/drug discovery data and familiarity with biomedical ontologies.

Title: AI Platform Engineer
Description:
AI Platform Engineer

An exciting biotech company dedicated to discovering and developing medicines for neurological disorders specifically within the small molecule space is looking for a new AI based Platform Engineer to join their growing team on a hybrid/remote basis.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the AI team to set project goals, develop strategic plans, and create product roadmaps.
Understand platform components to guide decisions and enhance scalability and interoperability.
Apply MLOps principles to transition machine learning models to production.
Write production-quality code, maintain documentation, and report progress.




Required Skills and Experience:

Advanced Python skills, with knowledge of Tensorflow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Experience in ETL processes, data modeling, data architecture, and data pipeline development.
Proficiency with graph databases (e.g., RDF, Neo4j) and query languages (e.g., SPARQL, Cypher); knowledge of relational databases is a plus.
Proven experience deploying machine learning models, especially in NLP or deep learning, in production.
Ability to work independently within a cross-functional team.
2-3 years of industry experience, preferably in life sciences.
[Preferred] Experience with life science/drug discovery data and biomedical ontologies.
[Preferred] Ability to collaborate with data scientists, data architects, bioinformaticians, and cheminformaticians.

Title: (Junior) Full Stack Data Scientist
Description:
With over 1,300 team members across 30 offices on three continents, FGS Global is the world’s no. 1 strategic communications consultancy. In Europe, we are a team of more than 300 employees working in eight offices in Germany, Amsterdam, Brussels, Paris and Zurich. When the stakes are high for our clients, especially in critical and complex situations, we safeguard their reputation and advance dialogue with key stakeholders on their behalf. Our approach is integrated, our teams are diverse with experience from journalism, corporate communications, digital communications, politics and investor relations.




The way we communicate is undergoing a fundamental change. This also applies to our clients, who find themselves confronted with entirely new stakeholder groups. In our Stakeholder Intelligence & Engagement Team, we assist our clients in understanding their stakeholders through quantitative and qualitative data analysis and in reaching them with tailored strategies across all communicative touchpoints, convincing them of our clients' objectives.




Join our Berlin team as (Junior) Full Stack Data Scientist.




What tasks can you look forward to?




Processing, cleaning, transforming and analyzing vast amounts of complex data, be it with standard, locally-trained AI models and ML algorithms, cutting-edge LLMs and other APIs, or other data mining procedures.




Conveying the results of such analyses to audiences with different backgrounds: from business and communication experts, to data scientists, statisticians, and mathematicians, in the form of formal non-technical presentations, rigorous written reports, or informal conversations.




Complement the standard data science skillset by being actively involved in the deployment, maintenance, and productization of your data science pipelines. This component is essential to this position and would take ~20% of your workload.







What should you bring along?




You are a motivated data scientist that is passionate about both data quality and code quality, graduated in an area that relies heavily on data and quantitative research.




You are proficient in the standard Python data science stack (e.g. numpy, scipy, sklearn, pandas) and have proven experience, or an eagerness to learn about, classical and modern NLP techniques.




You have proven experience in, or an eagerness to learn about, disciplines that complement the standard data science skillset, such as data engineering, software engineering, DevOps, MLOps, prompt engineering, QA/testing, etc.




You are open to learning new techniques, languages, tools, and theories that will enrich your knowledge base about data science and beyond.




Proven knowledge of Python is required, and will be demonstrated during the interview process. Experience in SQL, Javascript, or LookML is desirable.




You communicate fluently in written and spoken English.




You love variety and new challenges and really thrive when working in a team.







What we can offer you




Highly attractive starting salary




An inspiring working environment as well as the opportunity to work at one of our international offices for a limited period of time




Exciting tasks and attractive development prospects




Induction and individual support from an experienced colleague




Deepening of your expertise with regard to different sectors and areas of competence through close cooperation of our integrated project teams




Continuous training opportunities (FGS Global Academy)




A dedicated, supportive and growing team




A corporate culture that combines excellence with team spirit




The opportunity to work flexibly both in our offices and from home




Don’t meet every single requirement? Please don’t worry! Studies have shown that some groups like women or people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At FGS Global, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role and our company but your previous professional experience doesn’t match perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we would like to encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this or another role.




We look forward to your complete application (incl. all relevant academic and professional certificates and/or reference letters). Feel free to contact our HR team at +49 69 92 18 74-28 or by email at careers-eu@fgsglobal.com.




More information: FGS Global

Show more

At FGS Global, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role and our company but your previous professional experience doesn’t match perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we would like to encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this or another role.


We look forward to your complete application (incl. all relevant academic and professional certificates and/or reference letters). Feel free to contact our HR team at +49 69 92 18 74-28 or by email at careers-eu@fgsglobal.com.


More information: FGS Global

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist

Senior Data Scientist position with an environmental IoT startup based in Berlin Brandenburg. Our mission is to develop a large-scale IoT network that allows public and private forest owners to monitor, analyze and protect the world’s largest, most remote forests.







Responsibilities;

• Contributing to test experiments with regards to understanding and organization of resulting experiment data.

• Experiment within supporting locations utilising sensory equipment.

• Development of ETL pipeline to streamline the experiment data to AI models process.

• Development of a recognition model based on outputs of several sensor readings; ML experience including ideally deep learning is required.







Key Skills;

• Proficient in Python and machine learning frameworks, such as: TensorFlow, PyTorch or scikit-learn.

• Strong experience with modeling tabular data: Time Series Forecasting, Decision Trees, XGBoost, Ensemble techniques.

• Strong experience with advanced data analysis techniques.

• Experience with end-to-end ML pipeline tooling: ETL pipelines, MLflow.







Please attach a copy of your CV

Show more
HTML:
Senior Data Scientist

Senior Data Scientist position with an environmental IoT startup based in Berlin Brandenburg. Our mission is to develop a large-scale IoT network that allows public and private forest owners to monitor, analyze and protect the world’s largest, most remote forests.

• Contributing to test experiments with regards to understanding and organization of resulting experiment data.

• Experiment within supporting locations utilising sensory equipment.

• Development of ETL pipeline to streamline the experiment data to AI models process.

• Development of a recognition model based on outputs of several sensor readings; ML experience including ideally deep learning is required.



Key Skills;

• Proficient in Python and machine learning frameworks, such as: TensorFlow, PyTorch or scikit-learn.

• Strong experience with modeling tabular data: Time Series Forecasting, Decision Trees, XGBoost, Ensemble techniques.

• Strong experience with advanced data analysis techniques.

• Experience with end-to-end ML pipeline tooling: ETL pipelines, MLflow.



Please attach a copy of your CV

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Das erwartet Dich


Du begleitest unsere nationalen und internationalen Mandant*innen bei der Transformation der Steuerabteilung. An der Schnittstelle zwischen Steuerrecht und Technologie berätst du bei der Konzeption und Umsetzung von Datenstrategien.
Du wirkst maßgeblich beim Aufbau der datengetriebenen Produkte und Services wie z.B. Real-Time Reporting und Dataquality Dashboard von der Produktentwicklung bis hin zur Markteinführung mit.
Du übernimmst die Analyse und Visualisierung steuerrelevanter Daten.
Darüber hinaus bearbeitest du Mandantenausschreibungen und gestaltest mit deinem Know-how und deinen Ideen den Bereich Data & Analytics im Digital Tax Team aktiv mit.


Das bringst Du mit


Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, des Wirtschaftsingenieurswesen oder eines thematisch verwandten Studiengangs
Erste praktische Erfahrung im Bereich Data & Analytics im Rahmen von Praktika oder Werkstudententätigkeiten
Grundlegende Kenntnisse in Python oder R sowie im Bereich Datenmodellierung, Datenarchitektur und/oder Datenvisualisierung
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Microsoft Azure (Azure Synapse, Stream Analytics etc.) und hast Freude an Technologien und Kreativität bei deren Anwendung im steuernahen Umfeld.
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und gute Kenntnisse in Englisch


Darum Mazars


Lass dich fördern – Zahlreiche Entwicklungsprogramme und Trainingsangebote auf unserer globalen Lernplattform, darunter individuelle Lernpfade, Grundlagenschulungen, Offsites sowie Zugang zu LinkedIn Learning für deine persönliche und fachliche Entwicklung
Wir investieren in dich – Finanzielle Förderung von Berufsexamina sowie weiteren berufsrelevanten Qualifizierungen
Auf zu neuen Horizonten – Perspektivwechsel durch einen Auslandsaufenthalt oder Möglichkeit der Mitwirkung bei übergreifenden Projekten in Bereichen wie Innovation und Nachhaltigkeit
Wir bleiben in Bewegung – Ob mit dem BusinessBike ins Office oder beim After-Work-Fitness dank der Flatrate von Urban Sports Club
Dein Wellbeing ist uns wichtig – Individuelle Coachings, Teamworkshops sowie Zugang zu kostenlosen, anonymen Beratungsangeboten bei beruflichen oder privaten Herausforderungen für dich und deine Angehörigen
Deine Zeit zählt – Mobiles Arbeiten, 30 Tage Urlaub sowie bezuschusste Wertkonten für eine flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung (z.B. Sabbatical)
Show more

Title: AI Engineer - Germany
Description:
This is a remote position.

Note: One of our clients based in California, USA is creating a new team for a new project and hiring 7 AI Engineers globally. This is a 100% remote job and does not offer visa sponsorship. Please share your resume in English only.

Job Overview:

We are seeking a talented and motivated AI Engineer to join our innovative team. As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing cutting-edge artificial intelligence solutions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to create intelligent systems that enhance our products and services, ensuring they are at the forefront of technology.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI and machine learning models to solve complex business problems.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions.
Optimize and fine-tune AI algorithms for performance and scalability.
Conduct research to stay updated on the latest AI trends, tools, and techniques.
Develop and maintain robust, scalable, and efficient codebases for AI applications.
Perform data analysis and pre-processing to prepare datasets for training and evaluation.
Evaluate and implement new tools and frameworks to enhance AI development processes.
Work on integrating AI solutions with existing systems and infrastructure.
Troubleshoot and debug AI models and applications to ensure reliability and accuracy.
Document AI development processes, models, and outcomes for future reference.


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or C++.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical methods.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and AI services.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Excellent communication skills and ability to explain complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with deep learning techniques and neural networks.
Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools for AI model deployment and monitoring.
Previous experience in developing AI solutions for specific industries (e.g., healthcare, finance, retail).
Show more

Title: Data/ML Engineer (m/d/f)
Description:
Our vision: Our vision is to make surgery safer and smarter to help patients and caregivers when it matters most. Caresyntax is the only solution you need to make surgery smarter, safer, and more profitable. Our vendor-agnostic surgical technology platform enables you to capture new insights from video and harness new and existing healthcare data across your enterprise to streamline workflows, improve care delivery, and enhance patient outcomes – in and around your OR.

C.R.I.C., our values:


Customer Focus |Prioritizing customer needs with empathy and passion for customer satisfaction.
Resilience |Ownership to take initiative, follow through, persevere and do the right thing, even when it is challenging.
Innovation |A pioneering mindset and data-driven approach to urgently solve business and market challenges.
Collaboration |Acting as one team to intentionally foster work, communication and knowledge sharing.



Tasks

We’re looking for a Data/ML Engineer to join our Computer Vision team, focusing on building end-to-end Data pipelines, MLOps, and integrating large language models (LLMs).

Caresyntax is expanding rapidly in the EU market to serve EU-based hospitals and medical device companies. Our Computer Vision team aims to deliver intelligent solutions to assist surgical operations through the analysis of high-fidelity surgical videos. This critical role involves participating in the design, development, and maintenance of our AI solutions to provide high-performance experiences for end users, such as surgeons. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our solutions are scalable, efficient, and effective.

Tasks:


Infrastructure Development & Management: Design, build, and scale robust infrastructure using Terraform IasC for efficient machine learning model deployment, including orchestration, version control, and monitoring systems to ensure reliability and performance.
Automation & CI/CD Integration: Develop automation pipelines for model lifecycle management and integrate CI/CD practices for consistent model delivery.
Production Deployment & Monitoring: Deploy machine learning models into production environments and establish monitoring and alerting systems. Track model performance, health, and data drift while proactively troubleshooting issues and optimizing model efficiency.
Data Collection & Preparation: Gather and preprocess data from diverse sources, including structured data from data lakes, transactional databases, Electronic Health Records (EHR), as well as unstructured data from videos, images, and PDFs.
MLOps Infrastructure: Design and manage MLOps infrastructure on cloud platforms such as AWS and GCP to support scalable and efficient machine learning operations.
Generative AI & Text Processing: Develop and refine prompts for large language models (LLMs) and implement advanced text processing and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques. Focus on generating, summarizing, and analyzing text, images, and video to ensure high-quality, relevant, and contextually accurate outputs.
Code Review & Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough code reviews to maintain high standards of code quality and ensure adherence to best practices in software development.



At Caresyntax, we believe diversity goes far beyond checkboxes on a hiring form. Come as you are and with your unique knowledge! You might just hold the piece we've been yearning to find, completing the puzzle of our team in a way we never imagined.

Requirements


2-3 years of relevant or transferable experience (e.g., Data/Ops, Computer Vision/Machine Learning, CI/CD including GitLab, and DevOps/MLOps infrastructure/pipelines).
Comfortable with modern, cloud-native computing paradigms such as the Docker/Kubernetes ecosystem on AWS or a similar cloud provider.
Familiarity with Terraform IaC for infrastructure management.
Familiarity with data-oriented workflow orchestration frameworks like Airflow.
Familiarity with the architecture and operation of large language models, and a clear understanding of their capabilities and limitations.
Thorough understanding of Generative AI architectures (e.g., Retrieval Augmented Generation RAG).
Experience in development of Linux systems.
Strong coding skills in Python.
Healthcare experience is a significant plus.
Excellent communication, creativity, and problem-solving skills.



Nice to have


Understanding of high-performance computing on GPUs via frameworks like PyTorch, TensorRT
MLOps experience in terms of model monitoring, data drift detection, re-training implementation, model roll-back, for machine learning solutions
Python for ML or backend development



Education & Experience


1+ years experience building production-quality software.
Bachelors or Master’s degree and/or equivalent professional experience



Benefits


We offer you a permanent working contract with a competitive remuneration package!
10 Childsick days fully covered.
Warm-hearted, flexible, and solution-oriented culture with open feedback culture with performance review to accelerate your career goals!
International environment with more than 30 different nationalities!
Work-Life-Balance: Flexible working hours!
Wellness (at)CX: Wellness Bonus! A Wellness Stipend of 400 € net annual benefit to contribute to your personal health and wellness.
You will get access to a learning management tool to attend trainings and improve your skills and an yearly budget of 1,000€ to further develop your skills!
Access to the EAP (Employee Assistance Program) – Solution and support advice in regard to: mental and physical health, employment guidance, personal, family, financial and legal issues and questions.
We offer you a vibrant workspace! Regular team events included Christmas and summer parties!
Free coffee and drinks with weekly fresh fruit!
Free Corporate Massages!



Caresyntax is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage individuals from diverse backgrounds to apply. We are dedicated to making our technology accessible and available to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Show more

  • Warm-hearted, flexible, and solution-oriented culture with open feedback culture with performance review to accelerate your career goals!
